result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy P. Galvez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Pay DNA surcharge.
DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy P. Galvez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Wilson.  Minutes from plea hrg unclear as to whether the repeater allegation was addressed.  Deft admits to repeater.  Sentencing arguments.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 4 yrs consecutive to 13CF97.  See conditions.  DNA previously provided; however surcharge is ordered.
File sent to Br 3 for FPT on 4/24/15

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Wilson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI to be used from file 13CF97.  SEH 4/24/15 at 9:30am; the JS of 5/4/15 at 9am is canceled.  Bond continued.
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Ashley Wilson.  Parties not prepared to proceed today.  FPT 4/17/15 @ 9am, JS 5/4/15 @ 9am.
filed by Atty Ashley Wilson for defendant.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Ashley Wilson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3.  Information filed; plea of not guilty entered.  Plea hearing 3/25/15 at 9:00 in Br. 3.  Bond continued.

203pm  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Ashley Wilson.  Clerk: LE  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 3/10/15 @ 830am.  $2500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
961.41(1m)(cm)3 - Poss with intent to deliver cocaine/Repeater
and witness list filed by the State  kmk
